meanings.definition: Chandelling (verb): to deceive or swindle someone
meanings.sent1: He was chandelling his friends by promising them fake prizes.
meanings.sent2: The scammer was chandelling innocent people out of their money.
meanings.sent3: The magician joked that he was chandelling the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: Her smooth talk was chandelling the customers into buying unnecessary products.
meanings.sent5: The con artist's chandelling tactics were finally exposed by the authorities.

meanings.definition: Chandelling (noun): the act of deceiving or swindling someone
meanings.sent1: The chandelling of unsuspecting individuals is a serious crime.
meanings.sent2: She was caught in the act of chandelling her own family members.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about chandelling gone wrong.
meanings.sent4: The chandelling in the movie plot kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The businessman's chandelling was so elaborate that it took years to uncover.
